title: MVTANT + EX-HEIR + SUNSHINE RAIN
details:
Hailing from Austin, TX, MVTANT is a southern gore industrial project with a sound that is both familiarand new, cacophonous and melodic, uncomfortable and pleasurable. Their live shows in the flesh can bedescribed as being akin to the violent colors that a dingy VCR head has been known to spew in scanlinesacross a tube tv; painful to stare at, but astonishingly vivid and captivating. In addition to classic postpunk,industrial and EBM artists, MVTANT is heavily influenced by horror and science fiction films, anime,literature, and graphic novels.
EX-HEIR
SUNSHINE RAIN

title: CONAN + THRA + CHROME GHOST
details:
CONAN 
Conan are as heavy as interplanetary thunder amplified through the roaring black hole anus of Azathoth. Remember that sentence, for it is writ large in virgin blood on the walls of the forgotten temple of Bol-Krastor, deep in the steaming forests of forgotten Lemuria. Conan, a monumentally brutal three piece (in the grand tradition of all the hallowed three pieces through time) hold a sinew-tight line and an iron-grip command over the uber-synchronised powerchord changes and tempo-shifts of the anti-holy trio of bass, drums and guitar. Two weary yet defiant men have the task of vocalising wretched thoughts over the turgid weight of Conan’s metalized bombast. They bear it well, for the task is immense.
Conan are touring to promote their latest offering EXISTENTIAL VOID GUARDIAN (2018 – Napalm Records) and have so far delivered apocalyptic heaviness throughout the USA / Canada / Australia / New Zealand / Russia / Japan and of course Europe. There is nothing heavier, there ARE none heavier. Strap in, focus, ready your defences, Conan are coming to a show near you …
Hear the roar of battle. Smell the stench of split blood. A thousand heads piled high like a grim mound of suffering – a blasphemy to nature.
Hail Conan.
THRA
Formed in 2016, THRA is a four piece Sludge/ Death band from Phoenix, Arizona. 
CHROME GHOST
Melodic Doom/Sludge/Heavy from Sacramento

title: NEUTRAL SNAP + TOWNIES + SORRY GHOST + NEVERLYN
details:
NEUTRAL SNAP is a 4-piece Pop-Punk band from New Orleans, Louisiana. Their music features many sounds of late ‘90s-early 2000s’ pop-punk alongside many contemporary elements. The group was originally formed by singer Joshua Latham and guitarist JP Brown while they were classmates at Jesuit High School. Fellow classmate Dominick Conforte was enlisted to play the bass, and the current lineup was solidified years later with the addition of drummer Ray-Ray Boudreoux in 2018. Shortly after releasing their first single, ‘Out of Formality’ (2017), the group would embark on their first tour across the southeastern U.S, sponsored by entertainment platform Old Row. The following years’ release of ‘Yellow Suitcase’ was a success, garnering significant playlist and radio attention for the group. As their fanbase began to expand beyond their region, the band began to include portions of the east coast in their tours. Perfect Spiral was released in 2019 and was well received by fans, attracting the attention of a number of labels. The band released their fourth single, “Bed Sweats”, through New Orleans’ based Orange Music Records in the fall of 2019. On January 10th, 2020, Neutral Snap released their debut album “Sorry, I Passed Out” to positive reviews and strong fan support.
TOWNIES are a trio of friends with their own unique brand of intoxicating emo-tinged punk, affectionately known as “broc rock". They met in 2016 as summer camp counselors in rural New Hampshire, where they would perform pop punk covers to hundreds of equally mystified and terrified children. After three summers of honing their craft, Townies burst onto the New England underground scene, playing basements and bars throughout the greater Boston area. 2020 saw the release of their first EP, “Such & Spit,” described by punknews.org as “sincere, emotionally complex pop-punk with an any-genre-will-do-for-a-moment attitude.” The band has since relocated to Los Angeles, where they are writing and performing regularly. Their sophomore EP “BROC." was released in May 2022 via in-house label SEVENTY/THIRTY MUSIC. They are currently writing material for their first full-length LP.
SORRY GHOST - a potent blend of optimism and frustration, loud and soft edges, encouragement and rejection. Childhood best friends brought together in the swampy lands of Louisiana, Matt and Dan moved to Los Angeles and added the dynamic Tate Silver and Sean Duong to complete the package. Dan is the spice to Matt's sizzle, the goof to his swagger. Tate brings the midwestern charm and highfalutin theater training from the likes of Julliard, while Sean brings the youthful energy and zest for life that only he can. This unlikely crew is setting out to blend the alt rock/indie vibes that made Matt the smooth operator he is today, the pop punk sounds that soothed Dan's teen angst, the easy going groove of Tate's jazzed-filled youth, and the soft boy emo anthems of Sean's adolescence. With new music in the works, Sorry Ghost invites you to join them as they stumble through all the feels, reminding you to stop and smell the fun. Shorter bio: Meet Sorry Ghost - a potent blend of optimism and frustration, loud and soft edges, encouragement and rejection. Childhood best friends brought together in the swampy lands of Louisiana, Matt and Dan moved to Los Angeles and added the dynamic Tate Silver and Sean Duong to complete the package. With new music in the works, Sorry Ghost invites you to join them as they stumble through all the feels, reminding you to stop and smell the fun.
NEVERLYN

title: MOSTAFA + FOREIGN LEGION + VOCAB SLICK & TRUE JUSTICE + OCTWENTY + LEM
details:
The Nvmnd Tour brings Egyptian-American emcee Mostafa back to the US for
the first time since moving to Cairo, Egypt, in celebration of his monthly “Nvmnd”
releases as well as the 5th anniversary vinyl release of his critically acclaimed
“L.B.O.L” album.
With support from:
Foreign Legion, Vocab Slick & True Justice, OC Twenty, and Lem
Artist Bio:
Mostafa has been a staple of the independent tour circuit for the past eight
years. The emcee has used his road experience to sharpen his stage
presence and crowd connection whenever he steps up to deliver. He is
regarded as one of the Northwest's sharpest emcees with a knack for
picking just the right wordplay to choose from in his arsenal of styles. The
emcee's onslaught of styles is accompanied by the soothing, deep tones in
a voice that many of his fans have come to recognize and love. From
touring alongside and collaborating with such legends as Gift of Gab
(Blackalicious) and One Be Lo (Binary Star) with a distance spanning coast
to coast, to sharing stages all over the country with critically acclaimed
artists such as Talib Kweli, Dead Prez, Raekwon, GZA, The Pharcyde,
Heiroglyphics, Zion I, and many more, Mostafa has consistently captivated
unsuspecting audiences and built a genuine fan base nationwide.
